intro: Diplotaxis brevicaulis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandbur, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant features upright, branching stems covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, spiny fruits that are adapted for seed dispersal by animals. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a slightly hairy texture, and it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. Diplotaxis brevicaulis is also valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional uses in herbal medicine.
